list_ex_of_english: They are sportsmen, gallant and plucky, and all they want is to be properly trained.
The truth, however, is that the men think that the plucky little boy will make a good servant and look after their cattle.
It was a plucky speech from his point of view, a speech marked by statesmanship.
It is never easy to go against the customs of one's country, but they are very plucky.
It was a very plucky thing to do.
It is known, from the available facts, that the part played by the 'plucky coxswain' in the expedition was insignificant.
That is very plucky, is it not?
He said that it is a surprisingly twangy single, all plucky banjos and the like.
